revised_title: Re-assessing the Role and Function of Ascorbic Acid in Biochemistry
tldr: This article discusses the history, developments, and current understanding of ascorbic acid, also known as vitamin C. The author highlights the importance of ascorbic acid in preventing and curing scurvy, its synthesis, estimation, and public health measures. The article also touches upon the histological effects of ascorbic acid deficiency and the remaining gaps in our knowledge, such as its precise biochemical function and distribution in animal and plant tissues.
